summary: An email from a former FBI agent to an FBI contact regarding a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein with information about high-level government figures, including a former president. The email discusses connecting the victim to the FBI for an interview and references other related cases, including the murder of Arkansas Senator Linda Collins-Smith.

persons.name: Gents
persons.context: Former agent originally in Newark who is referenced by the email sender as having information about potential victims.

persons.name: Linda Collins Smith
persons.context: Mentioned as now murdered; the sender had brief contact with her about a CPS corruption case and child trafficking information.

connections.description: Both are referenced by the email sender as sources or contacts with information related to child trafficking and corruption.

events.title: Email regarding potential Epstein victim
events.description: An email is sent discussing a credible male victim of Epstein with information on high-level government people, including a former president, and requesting to connect him with the FBI for an interview.

events.title: Murder of Linda Collins-Smith
events.description: Reference to the murder of Arkansas Senator Linda Collins-Smith, who had information on child trafficking; the FBI is believed to be working on her murder case.

keyFacts: A potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein is described as credible and possessing information about high-level government figures, including a former president.
The email references a deceased female retired cop who was working on human trafficking and had connected with this victim.
The sender mentions the murder of Arkansas Senator Linda Collins-Smith, who had information on child trafficking, and notes the FBI is investigating her murder.
The email provides a process for future victims to contact the FBI via 1-800-CALL-FBI, where calls are tracked and directed to investigative teams.
